sentences.english: Silver Wings upon their chest, These are men, America's best.
sentences.chinese: 胸前别著银色的伞徽，他们是吾国最精锐的劲旅。

sentences.english: Yangzhou Eight Eccentric Artists develop an important group in Chinese painting history in 18th centuries.
sentences.chinese: 扬州八怪，是18世纪中国绘画史上的一支劲旅。

sentences.english: Jin merchant and Hui merchant are two business groups in Ming and Qing Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 晋商与徽商是活跃于明清商界的两大劲旅。
智利仍然是一支经济劲旅。

sentences.english: The brisk brave brigade broke the brick bridge across the broad bloody river.
sentences.chinese: 这支士气旺盛的劲旅拆毁了血水染红的大河上的砖桥。

sentences.english: The woman basketball team of our factory is one of the strongest (teams) in the city.
sentences.chinese: 本厂的女篮是全市的一支劲旅。

sentences.english: This football team was once reputed to be invincible.
sentences.chinese: 这支足球队曾被誉为无敌的劲旅。

definition: New Armies (modernized Qing armies, trained and equipped according to Western standards, founded after Japan's victory in the First Sino-Japanese War in 1895)
(sports) to go out of bounds/to go over the line/to qualify for the next round of competition/(Tw) (fig.) to make the grade/to achieve success
to face off against one's adversary (military, sports etc)
poised for battle/to square up for a fight
